title: Release/17-12-2024
body: This pull request prepares the release of a new version.

title: CONFIG - Add Discord Bot Token as Environment Variable in Render

labels.name: priority: medium
labels.description: A medium error causes a functionality to not work completely.  Also to declare the priority for a WI

body:
**Describe what aspect of configuration you are going to add**
We need to properly configure the Discord bot token as an environment variable in Render to ensure the bot (pringa_bot) can be deployed and work correctly without exposing sensitive information in the repository.

**Describe how you are going to implement it**
Access the Render Dashboard and navigate to the specific service for deployment.
In the Environment section of the Render settings, add a new environment variable:
Key: DISCORD_BOT_TOKEN
Value: [The newly reset Discord bot token]

title: BUG - Discord bot token exposed in public repository

labels.name: priority: medium
labels.description: A medium error causes a functionality to not work completely.  Also to declare the priority for a WI

body:
**Describe the bug**
The Discord bot token for pringa_bot was exposed in the .env.local.example file in the public repository, leading to the automatic reset of the bot's token by Discord for security reasons. This could allow unauthorized use of the bot if not resolved promptly.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Navigate to the GitHub repository: GitHub link.
2. Open the .env.local.example file.
3. Scroll down to the bot token line.
4.The bot token is visible in plain text.

**Expected behavior**
The bot token should not be exposed in any public files or repositories. Sensitive environment variables such as bot tokens should be kept secure, either by using local .env files that are listed in .gitignore or by using secrets management tools.

**Screenshots**
![imagen](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6ea0a6d7-2829-4957-a05c-2d17353e5f27)

title: Feat/Added pringa_bot link to the sidebar
body:
Now you can access to discord's pringa_bot at the page sidebar: 
![imagen](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0b507333-ac97-4316-a4f6-44e3a04720f0)

title: FEAT - Add "pringa_bot" Discord integration link to the sidebar

labels.name: priority: medium
labels.description: A medium error causes a functionality to not work completely.  Also to declare the priority for a WI

body:
**Describe your feature request**
Add an external link to the app's sidebar allowing users to easily add the "pringa_bot" to their Discord servers. This feature will provide users with a direct method to integrate the bot into their Discord communities, improving the bot's visibility and accessibility.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Include a link labeled "Add pringa_bot to Discord" to the sidebar that directs users to the Discord OAuth authorization page for the bot.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Adding the link in the footer instead of the sidebar, but placing it in the sidebar offers better visibility and aligns with other navigation items.

title: BUG - Appearance of datasets on a profile who shouldn't

labels.name: priority: medium
labels.description: A medium error causes a functionality to not work completely.  Also to declare the priority for a WI

body:
**Describe the bug**
If I access to an user, and I try to see the datasets of another user, datasets appear in staging area and unsynchronized.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to a dataset from another user.
2. Click on the profile
3. Scroll down to user datasets
4. If a dataset is on staging area, it will appear
5. If you click on it, it will show an error.

**Expected behavior**
The datasets which are on staging area and unsychronized shouldn't appear.

**Screenshots**
![imagen](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/de73edd7-b2a5-4003-a550-89f33b46c88a)
![imagen](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/93d8bd0f-2d7e-43a4-9017-925df775ecf8)

title: BUG - Error when updating a dataset with a publication type containing spaces

labels.name: priority: medium
labels.description: A medium error causes a functionality to not work completely.  Also to declare the priority for a WI

body:
**Describe the bug**
A bug has been detected whereby when you try to update a dataset by giving it a publication type with spaces it returns an error and does not update it.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to 'My datasets'
2. Click on 'Any dataset in staging area'
3. Update the dataset with a publication type value with spaces e.g. ‘Software Documentation’.
4. See error

**Expected behavior**
That it is satisfactorily updated

**Screenshots**
![imagen](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/78a05fcc-7b10-4c3d-848f-fb084f14eae7)
![imagen](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/28b779a1-3a48-471d-98c7-7d01cab9cd5d)


**Additional context**
You get the same error when trying to upload the dataset from the staging area to zenodo or fakenodo because before uploading it updates the dataset in case changes have been made.

title: Feature/Edit Community, Remove User from Community, and Add Search Functionality
body:
Edit Community:

    Implemented functionality to allow admins to edit the details of a community they own, including the name and description.

Remove User from Community:

    Added the option to remove users from a community. This action will ensure that users who are no longer part of the community are properly removed from the user list.

Search Communities:

    Introduced a search feature that enables users to search for communities by name. The search is case-insensitive and helps users find relevant communities more efficiently.

title: BUG - Incomplete requirements

labels.name: priority: critical
labels.description: A critical error prevents the application from functioning. Also to declare the priority for a WI

body:
**Describe the bug**
When logged in as administrator, the web page crashes.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to log in
2. Put admin1@example.com as user, '1234' as password
3. Press bottom "Iniciar sesión"
4. See error

**Expected behavior**

title: Feature/ Add functionality for managing community members
body:
This PR introduces the "Members" functionality to the community management system. It includes the following changes:

-     Display of Members Count: On the community detail page, users can now see the total number of members of a community.
-     Join Community: A button allows users to join a community if they are not already a member.
-     Leave Community: For users who are already members, a "Leave" button is available to exit the community.
-     Navigation Enhancements: Added a "View Members" button that redirects users to a list of community members.
-     Route and View Updates: New routes and views have been implemented to handle joining, leaving, and displaying community members.

title: BUG - Navigation buttons redirect incorrectly to 'communities'

labels.name: priority: minor
labels.description: A minor error causes minor aspects of the functionality to not behave as expected.  Also for WI

body:
Describe the bug

The buttons inside "My Communities" incorrectly redirect to the general "Communities" page. This issue affects the back buttons in the following cases:

    In the Show view of a community.
    After deleting a community.
    After creating a new community.

To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1.     Go to the "My Communities" section.
2.     Click on any community to view its details (Show view).
3.     Click the back button or perform a delete or create action.
4.     Notice that the buttons redirect to the general "Communities" page instead of "My Communities."

Expected behavior

The back buttons and navigation buttons should redirect to "My Communities" instead of the general "Communities" page.

Additional context

The issue likely arises from hardcoded URLs or incorrect routing logic in the button actions.

title: Fix/Error When Accessing a Community fixed
body:
The issue arose because the parameter in the route was <int:id>, but in the show_community function, the parameter used was community_id, creating an inconsistency that caused errors when trying to access a specific community. To resolve this, the parameter in the route was changed to <int:community_id>, and the function parameter was updated to match.

Additionally, upon reviewing the code, it was discovered that the same issue occurred in the function for deleting communities (delete). A generic id parameter was used in the route, while the function expected community_id. However, this issue was not visible until trying to access a community through show_community, as the community needed to exist before it could be deleted.

labels.description: A critical error prevents the application from functioning. Also to declare the priority for a WI

body:
**Describe the bug**
When attempting to access a route or perform an action that involves user authentication, a TypeError occurs because REMEMBER_COOKIE_KEY is None. Specifically, the error traceback shows that the application attempts to decode a "remember me" cookie, but the key required for HMAC operations is missing, leading to a TypeError.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Start the Flask application.
2. See error

**Expected behavior**
The application should work

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c3d4945d-41f4-4022-94c8-2f7e52f9e59f)

**Describe the bug**
The button to upload dataset to zenodo in staging area is not shown. This button is only shown when you add a new file to the UVL models section, but if there was a file added previously, the zenodo upload button is not shown.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to 'Upload datasets'
2. Fill in form by adding a uvl file and create the dataset in staging area
3. Click on 'my datasets'
4. Click on the new dataset that you created
5. See error

**Expected behavior**
The zenodo upload button should be displayed.

**Screenshots**
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b3ac118c-fd55-4981-80b3-5743c9f6938b)

title: BUG - Error in Uploading a Dataset to Zenodo from the Staging Area

labels.name: priority: medium
labels.description: A medium error causes a functionality to not work completely.  Also to declare the priority for a WI

body:
**Describe the bug**
There is an error when uploading a dataset to Zenodo from the staging area. This happens because the temporary folder cannot find the staging area file that was already assigned when the dataset was created and saved in the staging area.

This error only occurs with datasets previously stored in the staging area. If you create a dataset, place it in the staging area, and upload it to Zenodo within the same session, the error will not occur because the file will still be in the temporary folder. Therefore, the way this temporary folder is managed needs to be adjusted.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to 'My Datasets'
2. Click on a dataset in the staging area section that was created previously.
3. Add a new file to upload models dropdown section
4. Click on Upload dataset to zenodo
5. See error

**Expected behavior**
I want the request to upload the dataset to Zenodo to be successfully completed.

**Screenshots**
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/31205d92-6141-47fc-a4e6-2c1629d2e140)
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c21e60ab-5cab-4ad5-aedc-7d30ae3cde74)

title: Feature/view user profile
body: Se ha añadido la feature asociada al WI "view user profile", funcionando correctamente

title: Feature/Staging Area
body:
Complete staging area functionality, you can create datasets and save them in the staging area to make changes to the dataset data and upload them to Zenodo later. They can also be uploaded directly to Zenodo without going through the staging area.
A section has been added to my datasets where the datasets that are in the staging area are listed.

title: BUG - Link "Do you forgot your password?"

labels.name: priority: minor
labels.description: A minor error causes minor aspects of the functionality to not behave as expected.  Also for WI

body:
Actualmente para acceder a "Forgot my password" hay que hacerlo mediante url. 

Añadir un botón para acceder desde el login.

**Describe the bug**
Users can access to /forgot-password by a link or a button.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Explore the app
2. See that it doesn't exist any link to /forgot-password

**Expected behavior**
Users should have an easy and intuitive way to change their password, for example from the login form

**Screenshots**
N/A

**Additional context**
N/A

title: WI - Remember my password - Feature

labels.name: priority: medium
labels.description: A medium error causes a functionality to not work completely.  Also to declare the priority for a WI

body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
It is very common for users to forget their password. It is very useful to implement a functionality to be able to change the password

**Describe the solution you'd like**
In the login form, a link to another form will be shown where you can enter the email address and an email will be sent with a link to change the password.

title: WI- Sign up validation- Feature

labels.name: priority: medium
labels.description: A medium error causes a functionality to not work completely.  Also to declare the priority for a WI

body:
As a user, I want to receive an email confirmation after signing up to complete my account registration, ensuring that my email address is valid before accessing all features.

Currently, users can sign up but are not required to confirm their email address before logging into their accounts. This can lead to users entering invalid or incorrect email addresses during the sign-up process, which may cause issues with communication and account recovery.
